page.title: 17LITTLE CANFIELD, THE CHURCH
page.content: 1985 is a crisis year for this very pretty but isolated little church. Routine building work has revealed that the church is unsafe for use. It is estimated that Â£35,000 will be needed to make the church safe. At present, services have to be held in the village hall, the congregation has fallen to a handful of people. The question has been asked, should the church be made redundant or do we owe it to future generations to keep historic buildings like this in good repair. Meetings have been held and the villagers of Little Canfield have decided to try to raise the money needed. They are hoping to attract donations from individuals and from industry and to organise a grand prize draw. It would be sad if the Church Of All Saints Little Canfield only from one Domesday to die at the next.
